Package eutros.multiblocktweaker.crafttweaker.predicate

Interface IMatchValidator

Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface IMatchValidator
Can be used for matching either a layer, or the whole multiblock.

They are used internally by GregTech for the Distillation Tower, to ensure that each layer contains exactly one fluid output hatch.

ZenClass:
mods.gregtech.multiblock.IMatchValidator

  • Method Details

    • test

      boolean test(IPatternMatchContext context)

    • wrap

      static Predicate<gregtech.api.multiblock.PatternMatchContext> wrap(IMatchValidator validator)

    • and

      @Nonnull default IMatchValidator and(@Nonnull IMatchValidator other)
      Get an IMatchValidator that combines two predicates such that a block must pass both to be valid.

      Can be applied by just &.

      (validator_a as IMatchValidator).and(validator_b as IMatchValidator)

      is equivalent to

      validator_a as IMatchValidator & validator_b as IMatchValidator

      which is equivalent to

      function (context as IPatternMatchContext) as boolean { return (validator_a as IMatchValidator).test(context) && (validator_b as IMatchValidator).test(context); } as IMatchValidator

      Parameters:
      other - The other predicate, both this and other must succeed.
      Returns:
      A predicate that succeeds if both this and the other predicate succeed.

    • negate

      @Nonnull default IMatchValidator negate()
      Get an IMatchValidator that inverts a predicate such that blocks that fail the original pass the new one.

      Can be applied by just !.

      (validator as IMatchValidator).negate()

      is equivalent to

      !(validator as IMatchValidator)

      which is equivalent to

      function (context as IPatternMatchContext) as boolean { return !(validator as IMatchValidator).test(context); } as IMatchValidator

      Returns:
      A predicate that succeeds when this would fail, and fails when this would succeed.

    • or

      @Nonnull default IMatchValidator or(@Nonnull IMatchValidator other)
      Get an IMatchValidator that combines two predicates such that a block may pass either to be valid.

      Can be applied by just |.

      (validator_a as IMatchValidator).or(validator_b as IMatchValidator)

      is equivalent to

      validator_a as IMatchValidator | validator_b as IMatchValidator

      which is equivalent to

      function (context as IPatternMatchContext) as boolean { return (validator_a as IMatchValidator).test(context) || (validator_b as IMatchValidator).test(context); } as IMatchValidator

      Parameters:
      other - The other predicate, either this or other may succeed.
      Returns:
      A predicate that succeeds if this or the other predicate succeeds.
